LayoutNode.Content: Code review
LayoutNode.SRC: Code review

LayoutNode.Content: Seamless code review
LayoutNode.SRC: Seamless code review

LayoutNode.Content: Code review is the surest path to better code, and it’s fundamental to how GitHub works. Built-inreview tools make code review an essential part of your team’s process.
LayoutNode.SRC: Code review is the surest path to better code, and it’s fundamental to how GitHub works. Built-in review tools make code review an essential part of your team’s process.

LayoutNode.Content: Learn about code review →
LayoutNode.SRC: Learn about code review →

LayoutNode.Content: Propose changes Better code starts with a Pull Request, a livingconversation about changes where you can talkthrough ideas, assign tasks, discuss details, andconduct reviews.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Propose changes

Better code starts with a Pull Request, a living conversation about changes where you can talk through ideas, assign tasks, discuss details, and conduct reviews.

LayoutNode.Content: See the difference Reviews happen faster when you know exactly what’schanged. Diffs compare versions of your source codeside by side, highlighting the parts that are new,edited, or deleted.
LayoutNode.SRC:
See the difference

Reviews happen faster when you know exactly what’s changed. Diffs compare versions of your source code side by side, highlighting the parts that are new, edited, or deleted.

LayoutNode.Content: Request reviews If you’re on the other side of a review, you can requestreviews from your peers to get the exact feedback youneed.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Request reviews

If you’re on the other side of a review, you can request reviews from your peers to get the exact feedback you need.

LayoutNode.Content: Give clear feedback Your teammates shouldn’t have to think too hardabout what a thumbs up emoji means. Specifywhether your comments are required changes or justa few suggestions.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Give clear feedback

Your teammates shouldn’t have to think too hard about what a thumbs up emoji means. Specify whether your comments are required changes or just a few suggestions.

LayoutNode.Content: Comment in context Discussions happen in comment threads, right withinyour code. Bundle comments into one review, or replyto someone else’s inline to start a conversation.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Comment in context

Discussions happen in comment threads, right within your code. Bundle comments into one review, or reply to someone else’s inline to start a conversation.

LayoutNode.Content: Protect branches Only merge the highest quality code. You canconfigure repositories to require status checks,reducing both human error and administrativeoverhead.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Protect branches

Only merge the highest quality code. You can configure repositories to require status checks, reducing both human error and administrative overhead.

LayoutNode.Content: Share your work Want to use GitHub to work on a side project? See how to get started and make your next idea happen.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Share your work

Want to use GitHub to work on a side project? See how to get startedand make your next idea happen.

LayoutNode.Content: Project management
LayoutNode.SRC: Project management

LayoutNode.Content: Manage your ideas
LayoutNode.SRC: Manage your ideas

LayoutNode.Content: Coordinate early, stay aligned, and get more done with GitHub’s project management tools.
LayoutNode.SRC: Coordinate early, stay aligned, and get more done with GitHub’s project management tools.

LayoutNode.Content: Learn about project management →
LayoutNode.SRC: Learn about project management →

LayoutNode.Content: See your project’s big picture See everything happening in your project and choose where to focusyour team’s efforts with Projects, task boards that live right where theybelong: close to your code.
LayoutNode.SRC:
See your project’s big picture

See everything happening in your project and choose where to focus your team’s efforts with Projects, task boards that live right where they belong: close to your code.

LayoutNode.Content: Cards Reference every Issue and Pull Request in a card, adrag-and-droppable snapshot of the work your teams do in yourrepository.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Cards

Reference every Issue and Pull Request in a card, a drag-and-droppable snapshot of the work your teams do in your repository.

LayoutNode.Content: Notes Capture early ideas that come up as part of your standup or teamsync, without polluting your issues.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Notes

Capture early ideas that come up as part of your standup or team sync, without polluting your issues.

LayoutNode.Content: Track and assign tasks Issues help you identify, assign, and keep track of tasks within yourteam. You can open an Issue to track a bug, discuss an idea with an@mention, or start distributing work.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Track and assign tasks

Issues help you identify, assign, and keep track of tasks within your team. You can open an Issue to track a bug, discuss an idea with an @mention, or start distributing work.

LayoutNode.Content: Milestones Add a milestone to your Issue or Pull Request to organize and trackprogress on groups of issues or pull requests in a repository.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Milestones

Add a milestone to your Issue or Pull Request to organize and track progress on groups of issues or pull requests in a repository.

LayoutNode.Content: Assignees Assign an Issue or a Pull Request to one or more teammates tomake it clear who is doing what work.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Assignees

Assign an Issue or a Pull Request to one or more teammates to make it clear who is doing what work.

LayoutNode.Content: Integrations
LayoutNode.SRC: Integrations

LayoutNode.Content: The right tools for the job
LayoutNode.SRC: The right tools for the job

LayoutNode.Content: Browse and buy apps from GitHub Marketplace with your GitHub account. Find the tools you like or discover new favorites—then start using them in minutes.
LayoutNode.SRC: Browse and buy apps from GitHub Marketplace with your GitHub account. Find the tools you likeor discover new favorites—then start using them in minutes.

LayoutNode.Content: Browse GitHub Marketplace →
LayoutNode.SRC: Browse GitHub Marketplace →

LayoutNode.Content: Learn more about integrations →
LayoutNode.SRC: Learn more about integrations →

LayoutNode.Content: Discover new tools A well-timed app can complement your workflow and help your team accomplish more. Hundreds of tools work with GitHub to help your team communicate, automate work, and have a better day.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Discover new tools

A well-timed app can complement yourworkflow and help your team accomplish more. Hundreds of tools work with GitHub to helpyour team communicate, automate work, andhave a better day.

LayoutNode.Content: Extend GitHub Sometimes only a custom tool will do. Create your own tools with greater access to data than ever before using the GitHub GraphQL API —the same API we use to build GitHub.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Extend GitHub

Sometimes only a custom tool will do. Createyour own tools with greater access to data thanever before using the GitHub GraphQL API—thesame API we use to build GitHub.

LayoutNode.Content: Made for you, by us We’re building developer tools, too. We hopethey help you work on projects of any size andshare ideas with your friends and coworkers. Trythem out or help us build them.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Made for you, by us

We’re building developer tools, too. We hope they help you work on projects of any size and share ideas with your friends and coworkers. Try them out or help us build them.

LayoutNode.Content: Team management
LayoutNode.SRC: Team management

LayoutNode.Content: The human side of software
LayoutNode.SRC: The human side of software

LayoutNode.Content: Building software is as much about managing teams and communities as it is about code.Whether you’re on a team of two or two thousand, we’ve got the support your people need.
LayoutNode.SRC: Building software is as much about managing teams and communities as it is about code. Whether you’re on a team of two or two thousand, we’ve got the support your people need.

LayoutNode.Content: Manage and grow teams Help people get organized with GitHub teams, level up access with administrative roles, and fine tune your permissions with nested teams.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Manage and grow teams

Help people get organized with GitHub teams, level up access withadministrative roles, and fine tune your permissions with nested teams.

LayoutNode.Content: Keep conversations on topic Moderation tools, like issue and pull request locking, help your team stayfocused on code. And if you maintain an open source project, userblocking reduces noises and ensures conversations are productive.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Keep conversations on topic

Moderation tools, like issue and pull request locking, help your team stay focused on code. And if you maintain an open source project, user blocking reduces noises and ensures conversations are productive.

LayoutNode.Content: Set community guidelines Set roles and expectations without starting from scratch. Customizecommon codes of conduct to create the perfect one for your project.Then choose a pre-written license right from your repository.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Set community guidelines

Set roles and expectations without starting from scratch. Customize common codes of conduct to create the perfect one for your project. Then choose a pre-written license right from your repository.

LayoutNode.Content: Open source guides Our guides cover the fundamentals of open source maintenance—from starting a new project to getting paid for all your hard work . Learn more about open source at GitHub or get ready to launch a project of your own.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Open source guides

Our guides cover the fundamentals of open source maintenance—from starting a new project to getting paid for all your hard work. Learn more about open source at GitHubLearn more about open source at GitHub or get ready to launch a project of yourown.

LayoutNode.Content: Social coding
LayoutNode.SRC: Social coding

LayoutNode.Content: All together now
LayoutNode.SRC: All together now

LayoutNode.Content: With a community of 31 million developers , there are plenty of opportunities to connect with like-minded developers and the projects they create.
LayoutNode.SRC: With a community of 31 million developers, there are plenty of opportunities to connect withlike-minded developers and the projects they create.

LayoutNode.Content: * As of October 2018
LayoutNode.SRC: * As of October 2018

LayoutNode.Content: Follow projects Starring repositories lets maintainers know youappreciate their work and helps you track projectsyou don’t contribute to. Watch repositories to getnotifications when someone opens an issue orsubmits a pull request.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Follow projects

Starring repositories lets maintainers know you appreciate their work and helps you track projects you don’t contribute to. Watch repositories to get notifications when someone opens an issue or submits a pull request.

LayoutNode.Content: Explore your interests Get data powered project recommendations in your news feed. And with Explore , you can browse curated collections , trending repositories, and popular topics .
LayoutNode.SRC:
Explore your interests

Get data powered project recommendations inyour news feed. And with Explore, you can browsecurated collections, trending repositories, andpopular topics.

LayoutNode.Content: Share your achievements Show the public activity and proud momentsbehind your green squares. Pin your best work toyour profile or browse others’ timelines to see theprojects they’ve shaped.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Share your achievements

Show the public activity and proud moments behind your green squares. Pin your best work to your profile or browse others’ timelines to see the projects they’ve shaped.

LayoutNode.Content: Connect with the GitHub Community Introducing a new way to connect. Ask questions, learn new skills, and swap stories with developers around the world on the GitHub Community Forum .
LayoutNode.SRC:
Connect with the GitHub Community

Introducing a new way to connect. Ask questions, learn new skills, andswap stories with developers around the world on the GitHub Community ForumGitHub Community Forum.

LayoutNode.Content: Documentation
LayoutNode.SRC: Documentation

LayoutNode.Content: Documentation alongside your code
LayoutNode.SRC: Documentation alongside your code

LayoutNode.Content: Quality documentation is a hallmark of any healthy software project. On GitHub, you can createwell-maintained docs and make sure they receive the high level of care they deserve.
LayoutNode.SRC: Quality documentation is a hallmark of any healthy software project. On GitHub, you can create well-maintained docs and make sure they receive the high level of care they deserve.

LayoutNode.Content: GitHub Pages
LayoutNode.SRC: GitHub Pages

LayoutNode.Content: Host your documentation directly from your repositories with GitHub
LayoutNode.SRC: Host your documentation directly from your repositories with GitHub Pages

LayoutNode.Content: Pages . Use Jekyll as a static site generator and publish your Pages from
LayoutNode.SRC: GitHub Pages. Use Jekyll as a static site generator and publish your Pages from

LayoutNode.Content: the /docs folder on your master branch.
LayoutNode.SRC: the /docs folder on your master branch.

LayoutNode.Content: Learn more about publishing documentation on GitHub Pages →
LayoutNode.SRC: Learn more about publishing documentation on GitHub Pages →

LayoutNode.Content: Wikis Write documentation using the power of version control. Each wiki is its own repository, so every change is versioned and comparable. A text editor lets you easily add your docs in the text formatting language of your choice, like Textile or GitHub Flavored Markdown .
LayoutNode.SRC:
Wikis

Write documentation using the power of version control. Each wiki is itsown repository, so every change is versioned and comparable. A texteditor lets you easily add your docs in the text formatting language ofyour choice, like Textile or GitHub Flavored Markdown.

LayoutNode.Content: Say "Hello, world" In need of a site for your project? You can also host static sites to promote a project or portfolio with GitHub Pages .
LayoutNode.SRC:
Say "Hello, world"

In need of a site for your project? You can also host static sites topromote a project or portfolio with GitHub Pages.

LayoutNode.Content: Code hosting
LayoutNode.SRC: Code hosting

LayoutNode.Content: All your code in one place
LayoutNode.SRC: All your code in one place

LayoutNode.Content: GitHub is one of the largest code hosts in the world with over 96 million projects. Private, public, or open source, all repositories are equipped with tools to help you host, version, and release code.
LayoutNode.SRC: GitHub is one of the largest code hosts in the world with over 96 million projects. Private, public,or open source, all repositories are equipped with tools to help you host, version, and releasecode.

LayoutNode.Content: * As of October 2018
LayoutNode.SRC: * As of October 2018

LayoutNode.Content: Host all your code Repositories help you keep code in one place, even if you use SVN or work with large files using Git LFS . With unlimited private repositories included in all GitHub plans , you can create or import as many projects as you’d like. Make changes confidently Make changes to your code in precise commits so you can quickly search every commit message in your revision history to find a change. Use the blame view to trace changes and discover how your file, and your code base, has evolved. Package and release code When you’re ready to share, you can package your changes from a recently closed milestone or finished project into a new release . Draft and publish release notes, publishpre-release versions, attached files, and linkdirectly to the latest download.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Host all your code

Repositories help you keep code in one place, even if you use SVN or work with large filesusing Git LFS.With unlimited private repositories included in all GitHub plans, you can create or import asmany projects as you’d like.

Make changes confidently

Make changes to your code in precise commitsso you can quickly search every commit messagesearch every commit message in your revision history to find achange.Use the blame view to trace changes anddiscover how your file, and your code base, hasevolved.

Package and release code

When you’re ready to share, you can packageyour changes from a recently closed milestoneor finished project into a new release.

Draft and publish release notes, publish pre-release versions, attached files, and link directly to the latest download.

LayoutNode.Content: Flexible hosting plans All your code in one place, wherever you need to host it. Get the sameexperience whether you’re hosting GitHub in the cloud, on your servers,or on AWS or Azure. Compare plans and features →
LayoutNode.SRC:
Flexible hosting plans

All your code in one place, wherever you need to host it. Get the same experience whether you’re hosting GitHub in the cloud, on your servers, or on AWS or Azure.

Compare plans and features →

LayoutNode.Content: Trusted by more than 2.1M businesses and organizations
LayoutNode.SRC: Trusted by more than 2.1M businesses and organizations

LayoutNode.Content: Bring GitHub to work A smarter way to work together. Plan, build, review, and shipsoftware—securely on GitHub.com or your own servers. Learn more
LayoutNode.SRC:
Bring GitHub to work

A smarter way to work together. Plan, build, review, and ship software—securely on GitHub.com or your own servers.

Learn more

LayoutNode.Content: Start a new project GitHub is free to use for public and open source projects. Work togetheracross unlimited private repositories with a paid plan. Sign up for GitHub
LayoutNode.SRC:
Start a new project

GitHub is free to use for public and open source projects. Work together across unlimited private repositories with a paid plan.

Sign up for GitHub
